test-case.name: last-1
test-case.description: Evaluation of "fn:last", where context function is an element node and the position is last.

test-case.name: last-2
test-case.description: Evaluation of "fn:last", where the context node is not defined.

test-case.name: last-3
test-case.description: Evaluation of "fn:last", where the first item is selected.

test-case.name: last-4
test-case.description: Evaluation of "fn:last" together with "fn:position".

test-case.name: last-5
test-case.description: Evaluation of "fn:last" together with "fn:position" (format last() = position()).

test-case.name: last-6
test-case.description: Evaluation of "fn:last" together with the "<<" node operator

test-case.name: last-7
test-case.description: Evaluation of "fn:last" together with the "is" node operator casted to integer inside the predicate.

test-case.name: last-8
test-case.description: Evaluation of "fn:last" where two last functions are used inside the predicate.

test-case.name: last-9
test-case.description: Evaluation of "fn:last" where the last function is used inside a second predicate.

test-case.name: last-10
test-case.description: Evaluation of "fn:last" where the last function is used inside the first predicate.

test-case.name: last-11
test-case.description: Evaluation of "fn:position" used in conjunction with the fn:not function

test-case.name: last-12
test-case.description: Evaluation of "fn:position" as a predicate to a wildcard (*).

test-case.name: last-13
test-case.description: Evaluation of "fn:position" used together with an addition operation.

test-case.name: last-14
test-case.description: Evaluation of "fn:position" used together with a subtraction operation.

test-case.name: last-15
test-case.description: Evaluation of "fn:position" used together with a multiplication operation.

test-case.name: last-16
test-case.description: Evaluation of "fn:position" used together with a division (div) operation.

test-case.name: last-17
test-case.description: Evaluation of "fn:position" used together with a division (idiv) operation.

test-case.name: last-18
test-case.description: Evaluation of "fn:position" used together with a logical expression ("and" operator and "true" function).

test-case.name: last-19
test-case.description: Evaluation of "fn:position" used together with a logical expression ("and" operator and "false" function).

test-case.name: last-20
test-case.description: Evaluation of "fn:position" used together with a logical expression ("or" operator and "true" function).

test-case.name: last-21
test-case.description: Evaluation of "fn:position" used together with a logical expression ("or" operator and "false" function).

test-case.name: last-22
test-case.description: Evaluation of "fn:position" used in the middle of a path expression.

test-case.name: last-23
test-case.description: Evaluation of "last()" within a positional predicate

result.assert-deep-eq: "Jane Doe 5", "John Doe 6", "Jane Doe 7", "John Doe 8", "Jane Doe 9", "John Doe 10", "Jane Doe 11", "John Doe 12", "Jane Doe 13"

test-case.name: last-24
test-case.description: Top-level call on last()

test-case.name: last-25
test-case.description: last() as the last step in a path (demonstrate that "/" is left-associative)

test-case.name: K-ContextLastFunc-1
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `last(1)`.

test-case.name: K-ContextLastFunc-2
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `(1, 2, 3)[if(1) then 1 else last()]`.

test-case.name: K-ContextLastFunc-3
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `deep-equal((1, 2, 3)[count((last(), last())) eq 2], (1, 2, 3))`.

test-case.name: K-ContextLastFunc-4
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `deep-equal((1, 2, 3)[last() eq last()], (1, 2, 3))`.

test-case.name: K-ContextLastFunc-5
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `(1, 2, 3, current-time())[last() - 1] treat as xs:integer eq 3`.

test-case.name: K-ContextLastFunc-6
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `empty((1, 2, 3, current-time())[last() + 1])`.

test-case.name: K-ContextLastFunc-7
test-case.description: fn:last() can never return 0('=').

test-case.name: K-ContextLastFunc-8
test-case.description: fn:last() can never return 0('='), #2.

test-case.name: K-ContextLastFunc-9
test-case.description: fn:last() can never return 0('eq').

test-case.name: K-ContextLastFunc-10
test-case.description: fn:last() can never return 0('eq'), #2.

test-case.name: K-ContextLastFunc-11
test-case.description: fn:last() can never return 0('!=').

test-case.name: K-ContextLastFunc-12
test-case.description: fn:last() can never return 0('ne').

test-case.name: K-ContextLastFunc-13
test-case.description: fn:last() can never return 0('!=').

test-case.name: K-ContextLastFunc-14
test-case.description: fn:last() can never return 0('ne'), #2.

test-case.name: K-ContextLastFunc-15
test-case.description: fn:last() can never return anything less than 1(lt).

test-case.name: K-ContextLastFunc-16
test-case.description: fn:last() can never return anything less than 1(<).

test-case.name: K-ContextLastFunc-17
test-case.description: fn:last() can never return anything less or equal to 0(le).

test-case.name: K-ContextLastFunc-18
test-case.description: fn:last() can never return anything less or equal to 0(<=).

test-case.name: K-ContextLastFunc-19
test-case.description: The return value of fn:last() is always greater than 0('ne').

test-case.name: K-ContextLastFunc-20
test-case.description: The return value of fn:last() is always greater than 0('>').

test-case.name: K-ContextLastFunc-21
test-case.description: The return value of fn:last() is always greater than 0('gt').

test-case.name: K-ContextLastFunc-22
test-case.description: The return value of fn:last() is always greater or equal to 0('>=').

test-case.name: K-ContextLastFunc-23
test-case.description: The return value of fn:last() is always greater or equal to 0('ge').

test-case.name: K-ContextLastFunc-24
test-case.description: fn:last() inside a predicate combined with a offset.

test-case.name: K-ContextLastFunc-25
test-case.description: fn:last() inside a predicate combined with a offset.

test-case.name: K-ContextLastFunc-26
test-case.description: fn:last() inside a predicate.

test-case.name: K-ContextLastFunc-27
test-case.description: fn:last() inside a predicate and an insignificant offset.

test-case.name: K-ContextLastFunc-28
test-case.description: fn:last() inside a predicate combined with a range expression.

test-case.name: K-ContextLastFunc-29
test-case.description: fn:last() inside a predicate combined with a range expression and offset.

test-case.name: cbcl-last-in-sequence-001
test-case.description: test fn:first-in-sequence on sub-expression where quant = 1
test-case.test: declare function local:generate($arg as xs:integer?) { if ($arg = 0) then (1, 2, 3) else () }; ( local:generate(0), 1, local:generate(0) )[last()]

test-case.name: cbcl-last-in-sequence-002
test-case.description: test fn:first-in-sequence on a for expression
test-case.test: declare function local:generate($arg as xs:integer?) as xs:integer* { if ($arg = 0) then (1, 2, 3) else $arg }; ( local:generate(()), for $x in local:generate(0) return $x + 2 )[last()]

test-case.name: cbcl-last-in-sequence-003
test-case.description: test fn:first-in-sequence on a for expression
test-case.test: declare function local:generate($arg as xs:integer?) as xs:integer? { if ($arg = 0) then 0 else () }; ( local:generate(()), for $x in local:generate(0) return $x + 2 )[last()]

test-case.name: cbcl-last-in-sequence-004
test-case.description: test fn:first-in-sequence on a for-at expression
test-case.test: declare function local:generate($arg as xs:integer?) as xs:integer* { if ($arg = 0) then ( 1, 2, 3 ) else ( $arg ) }; ( local:generate(()), for $x at $p in local:generate(0) return $p + $x)[last()]

test-case.name: cbcl-last-in-sequence-005
test-case.description: test fn:first-in-sequence on a for-at expression
test-case.test: declare function local:generate($arg as xs:integer?) as xs:integer? { if ($arg = 0) then 1 else $arg }; ( local:generate(()), for $x at $p in local:generate(0) return $p + $x)[last()]

test-case.name: cbcl-last-in-sequence-006
test-case.description: test fn:first-in-sequence on a map expression
test-case.test: declare function local:generate($arg as xs:integer?) as xs:string* { if ($arg = 0) then ('a', 'b', 'c') else ('d' ) }; ( if (local:generate(1) = 'd') then () else 1, for $x in local:generate(0) return fn:lower-case($x))[last()]

test-case.name: cbcl-last-in-sequence-007
test-case.description: test fn:first-in-sequence on a map expression
test-case.test: declare function local:generate($arg as xs:integer?) as xs:integer? { $arg }; ( if (local:generate(0) = 0) then () else 1, for $x in local:generate(0) return -$x)[last()]

test-case.name: cbcl-last-in-sequence-008
test-case.description: test fn:first-in-sequence on a distinct-doc-order

test-case.name: cbcl-last-in-sequence-009
test-case.description: test fn:first-in-sequence on a for-each expression Author: Tim Mills
test-case.test: declare function local:generate($arg as xs:integer?) as xs:string* { if ($arg = 0) then ('a', 'b', 'c') else () }; ( local:generate(()), for $x in local:generate(0) return 3)[last()]

test-case.name: cbcl-last-in-sequence-010
test-case.description: test fn:boolean on fn:first-in-sequence
test-case.test: declare function local:generate($arg as xs:integer?) as xs:string* { if ($arg = 0) then ('a', 'b', 'c') else () }; boolean(local:generate(0)[last()])

test-case.name: cbcl-last-in-sequence-011
test-case.description: test fn:boolean on fn:first-in-sequence
test-case.test: declare function local:generate($arg as xs:integer?) as xs:string* { if ($arg = 0) then ('a', 'b', 'c') else () }; boolean(local:generate(1)[last()])

test-case.name: cbcl-last-in-sequence-012
test-case.description: test fn:first-in-sequence on a for-each expression
test-case.test: declare function local:generate($arg as xs:boolean) as xs:string+ { if ($arg) then ('a', 'b', 'c') else ('A', 'B', 'C') }; ( for $x in local:generate(true()) return 3)[last()]
